intro: Carpolobia gossweileri, commonly known as the African arrowroot, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its upright, branching stems and large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
